instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Slow, SMC was replaced.
threads.message:
I have a board that works normally except it's really slow and gives these errors:
"There may be an issue with the System Management Controller (SMC) Reference Code: PFM006"     
"There may be an issue with the power management system. Reference Code: PPN001."

The SMC was definitely replaced. Any ideas what might be happening? Is this the result of an incorrect SMC being installed? Wrong year maybe?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Slow, SMC was replaced.
threads.message: Verify if both voltage sensors are working <TRANSISTOR>Q5480</TRANSISTOR>/90. Check SMC version in "about this mac"

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Slow, SMC was replaced.
threads.message: Check te version of the SMC firmware.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Slow, SMC was replaced.
threads.message: Ups! you beat me Duco... lol

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Slow, SMC was replaced.
threads.message:
2.28f7

Seems like the right version from what I can tell.

<TRANSISTOR>Q5480</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q5490</TRANSISTOR> are both passing 12.6V through and the voltage is being dropped down properly to 2V for the SMC.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Slow, SMC was replaced.
threads.message: See if iStat menus picks up a sensor that reports weird values. Was BIOS ever touched?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Slow, SMC was replaced.
threads.message: Yes, definitely. Someone replaced the SMC, or at least did extensive work on it. No issue with iStat. Everything normal.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Slow, SMC was replaced.
threads.message: Make sure to visually inspect all current sensors (INA21*) and after that I would first put a known good SMC on there.
